message.content:
We wish to “build up” the balance‐sheet item “inventory” by assuming that at the beginning (after the “initial” entries) no inventory is on‐hand – then every purchase of a product increases inventory (by its “cost” – here determined from quantity × cost_per_unit) and every sale of a product “reduces” inventory by its cost (again determined by quantity × cost_per_unit). (All transactions that concern “Fixed Assets” or “Cash/Bank” in the “Initial…” rows are not “inventory”.)

In the table below the only “initial” rows are three “Initial20231231001” records. None of these record a beginning inventory (they just put cash, bank and fixed assets). Thus we start with an initial inventory value of 0.00.

Then, if we “read‐through” the file and add up – for every “Purchase” row – the (quantity × cost_per_unit) and subtract – for every “Sale” row – the (quantity × cost_per_unit) we get (approximately) the inventory “ending” cost.

For example (showing a few sample computations):

• For the row with id Purchase20231231001 (a purchase of product F001 “Quick Meal Set”) the entry is: quantity = 236, cost_per_unit = 150.0, so that purchase adds 236×150.0 = 35,400.0 to inventory.

• Similarly, for each “Purchase” row (by checking all rows with type “Purchase”) one obtains a total (by adding the “amount” provided — which equals quantity × cost_per_unit) that sums to

  8,962,650.0

• Then, for each “Sale” row we “remove” inventory at cost. For example, the sale with id Sale20240102002 involves selling 4 units at a cost of 150.0 each so that 4×150.0 = 600.0 is “taken out.” Doing that for every “Sale” row and summing these “costs” we get a total cost that has been “removed” of

  508,690.0

Thus the end‐of–period inventory value is computed by

  Inventory End Value = (Initial inventory) + (Total Purchases cost) − (Total Sales cost)
            = 0.00 + 8,962,650.0 − 508,690.0 
            = 8,453,960.0

So in our answer we have:

Initial inventory = "0.00"  
Ending inventory = "8453960.00"

We now report the answer in the requested json format.

Final answer:
--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Inventory Initial Value": "0.00", "Inventory End Value": "8453960.00"}}
